definition[0]: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted
example[0]: The credit card eliminates the need for cash or cheques.
example[1]: There is no solution that will totally eliminate the possibility of theft.
example[2]: Fatty foods should be eliminated from the diet.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say get rid of rather than eliminate:
example[3]: It is almost impossible to get rid of the problem.
definition[1]: to defeat a team or person in a competition, so that they no longer take part in it
example[4]: Our team was eliminated in the first round.
explanation[1]: Eliminate is usually passive in this meaning
definition[2]: to kill someone in order to prevent them from causing trouble
example[5]: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
definition[3]: to get rid of something unnecessary or unwanted
example[6]: The company plans to eliminate 2,100 jobs.
